docs.title: SystemC-FMI: Seamless Co-Simulation Between SystemC and FMI
docs.text:
SystemC-FMI is a powerful open-source framework that bridges SystemC and the Functional Mock-up Interface (FMI), making it effortless to integrate SystemC-based models with FMI-compliant Functional Mock-up Units (FMUs).

With SystemC-FMI, you can easily bring your SystemC simulations into any FMI 3.0–compatible environment, enabling true multi-domain co-simulation and interoperability across tools and platforms.

docs.title: ⚡ What SystemC-FMI Offers
docs.text:
• ✅ Wrap SystemC and SystemC-TLM modules as FMUs: automatically convert your SystemC designs into FMI 3.0 Co-Simulation FMUs
  • ✅ Automate the entire FMU lifecycle: from generation to compilation to packaging, all streamlined
  • ✅ Integrate seamlessly: run co-simulations that combine hardware-accurate models with system-level tools

docs.title: 🌍 Why It Matters
docs.text:
By combining SystemC’s precision with FMI’s universality, SystemC-FMI enables simulation workflows that were previously complex or fragmented, perfect for cross-domain engineering and digital twin scenarios.

Use it to co-simulate and validate systems such as:

  • 🚗 Virtual ECUs and automotive components
  • 📶 Mixed-signal or digital-analog environments
  • 🧪 Software/hardware-in-the-loop (SIL/HIL) testbenches

docs.title: 🎯 Ideal For
docs.text:
By combining SystemC’s precision with FMI’s universality, SystemC-FMI enables simulation workflows that were previously complex or fragmented, perfect for cross-domain engineering and digital twin scenarios.

Use it to co-simulate and validate systems such as:

  • 💻 Embedded systems development
  • 🛠️ Virtual prototyping and pre-silicon verification
  • 📐 Model-based design and simulation workflows

Whether you’re building a realistic hardware model or testing complex system interactions, systemC-fmi provides the bridge that makes it all possible.
